newsitem.title: UK: IPE gas oil closes firmer after NYMEX leads rally.
newsitem.headline: IPE gas oil closes firmer after NYMEX leads rally.

text.p: IPE gas oil futures closed firmer on Thursday tracking a surge in NYMEX crude and products futures.
May gas oil ended $1.50 a tonne higher at $169.00, having traded at a session high of $170.00.
"We dipped off with New York and with the crude, gas oil was just following the others today," a broker said.
NYMEX unleaded gasoline spear-headed the rally which took NYMEX crude through key resistance at $19.90 a barrel and important psychological resistance at $20.00.
There was talk that operational snags at two U.S. Gulf Coast refineries had shut in gasoline production, but this could not be immediately confirmed.
The the market edged off earlier highs and some traders said that it was vulnerable to further losses.
June Brent was trading 43 cents up at $18.59 a barrel, having touched a session high of $18.63.
Dealers said that the market regarded news that OPEC was likely to leave it output celing unchanged as fairly neutral.
"It's overproduction that is the key issue," said one broker.
OPEC President Libyan Oil Minister Abdullah Salem al-Badri told Reuters on Thursday that he expected to group to stick with its 25.03 million barrels per day (bpd) output quota when it meets in June.
Seven OPEC oil ministers have scheduled talks in Isfahan in Iran for Thursday to discuss quota violations which have helped knock $7 a barrel off oil prices since the start of the year.
A Reuters survey on Thursday estimated OPEC's April output at 27.05 million bpd.
